title: The Root Invaders
description: A species of fast-growing root vine is consuming the Green Quarter's Central Gardens — choking slower-growing rare plants. Head Gardener Bessa identifies it as Deeproot Vine, a Scourge-adjacent invasive species. She needs it removed before it spreads to the medicinal plant section.

turns.narrative: The Deeproot Vine is aggressive — it grows noticeably as you watch. Its tendrils are pale and slightly luminescent at the tips, suggesting Void-adjacent origin. Bessa says mechanical removal doesn't work: it grows back from the root system in forty-eight hours.
turns.choice_a: Ask Alchemist Rynn if a chemical suppressant could halt the root system
turns.consequence_a: Rynn provides a salt-based soil compound that inhibits Void-adjacent root growth. She estimates two applications to fully suppress the current patch.
turns.choice_b: Attempt manual removal of as much of the root system as you can access
turns.consequence_b: Manual removal takes three hours and clears seventy percent of the accessible root system. Combined with other treatment this is a good start.

turns.narrative: Rynn's assessment is that the vine was carried in via a compost amendment from the Agricultural Zone — the same batch causing problems elsewhere. The vine's root system goes down about two metres.
turns.choice_a: Apply Rynn's soil compound treatment to the entire affected area
turns.consequence_a: Two applications over two days. The vine shows visible decline by day three.
turns.choice_b: Use controlled shallow burning of the soil surface to kill the above-ground vine before applying the compound
turns.consequence_b: The burn plus compound combination works faster. The vine is effectively neutralised in a single day.

turns.narrative: Bessa wants to prevent future invasive species introductions.
turns.choice_a: Recommend a compost quarantine protocol for any new soil amendments entering the Green Quarter
turns.consequence_a: Bessa implements the protocol. All incoming compost is held for a two-week observation period.
turns.choice_b: Help Bessa plant aggressive ground-cover species in the cleared area that will naturally compete against future vine invasions
turns.consequence_b: Fast-growing competitive low-native plants are installed. The cleared area is defended naturally.

ground_cover_planted.description: Competitive ground cover planted. Future invasions deterred.

risk_matrix.critical_failure: The attempt failed quietly. The situation remains unresolved.
